results.title: Toyota : Alex 'Jezza' Jesaulenko [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
Stephen Curry and Dave Lawson, with the help of Alex Jesaulenko, relive ‘Jezza’s‘ high flying mark during the 1970 VFL Grand Final.
Produced by Mojo MDA.

results.title: Sharpies [a gathering]
results.brief_description: Greg Mcainsh’s 1974 film ‘Sharpies’ documented a massive gathering of the Melbourne Sharpies at a Lobby Loyde concert. The final black and white short film is an exemplary cultural document of a time, a place and a powerful gathering of cultural resistance. This work uses the original footage and materials to present a silent exploration of the Sharpies at this particular moment in Melbourne’s history.

results.title: The Queen Mother at Essendon Airport
results.brief_description:
Silent footage of the arrival on 27 February 1958 of the Queen Mother at Essendon Airport to a welcoming crowd of waving spectators, military parades and marching bands, and government officials and dignitaries. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Melbourne city parade
results.brief_description: Silent film of the Queen Mother arriving at the Melbourne Town Hall during a Moomba parade. Includes scenes of crowds lining Swanston Street; the Lord Mayor’s welcoming speech to the Queen Mother; and her departure in an open car as she waves to the crowd. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Maroondah Dam
results.brief_description:
Silent 1950s home movie footage of a family outing to the Maroondah Dam in the Upper Yarra Valley. Includes images of the landscape and boating facilities. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Mallacoota fishing trip
results.brief_description:
Mallacoota - There is boatloads of nostalgic charm in this short black and white 1950s film of men taking a fishing trip at Mallacoota. Photographer Athol Adams has captured a sense of fun in this footage, made more entertaining to modern eyes because of the formal clothes the fishermen are wearing. A wonderful glimpse of a different generation at play.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Peaches are a lustful fruit
results.brief_description: In 1960, when Domenic was 10, his father left Italy for Australia to work in Cobram. A year later Domenic followed with his mother and sisters. ” I never went to school in Australia so my voyage from Italy was the end of my childhood” Domenic’s story represents that of the many migrant workers who have helped build Australian agriculture. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Training for the last run
results.brief_description: Commonwealth gold medallist Raelene Boyle faced her toughest challenge in the fight against breast cancer. ‘My breast cancer diagnosis in 1996 did see me race again. This time it was a race to survive’. Created in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Journeys with Breast Cancer’ in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia.

results.title: Moomba belonged to my grandfather
results.brief_description: Moomba belonged to my grandfather, Tom Wittingslow. Of all the shows and carnivals we did all over Australia, Moomba was the best. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Festival.
